page.title: 19An Edlington Retired Miner.
page.content: David Heggie came to Edlington 25yrs ago from Scotland,"a land of beauty" because of pit closures;lodged for a year until the N.C.B.houses were complete & his family moved down.His first impressions were favourable;the newcomers were treated as equals.As every mining village,he says,Edlington has genuine,self-sacrificing,community minded folk.He filled his new home with music,had a"low-key"bet on the horses,went to bingo & the theatre, supported Doncaster Rovers,& kept his interest in politics.Working down the pit is like no other job,he says;you are conscious but not obsessed with safety;men work in often unsavoury conditions;no toilets underground; breathing dust.New industry did bring a growth in prosperity but David feels that this,the mining industry & community spirit are sadly in decline.
